business.headline: IndusInd Bank's ex-CFO records statement in accounting lapse probeMumbai Police's Economic Offences Wing (EOW) has so far recorded statements of seven to eight employees of the bank. Ex-CFO Gobind Jain recorded his statement today.

Income tax refund claim rejected? CA explains how to rectify and reapplyGetting your income tax refund rejected can be unsettling, especially after filing on time. But in most cases, the issues are minor and fixable. Here's a look at why rejections occur and how to reapply successfully.

Gold, silver or equity: Where should you invest right now?Gold prices touched a fresh record high on the 1st day of Navrartri, once again sparking the age-old debate among investors: where should money be parked during this time, gold, silver, or equity?

Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw discusses GST, MSME benefits, key reformsUnion Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw held a press conference, detailing the benefits of GST reform. The Minister explained how GST advantages extend to all states, estimating a saving of Rs 3,500 for a middle-class family.

Sensex falls over 450 points, Nifty settles lower as IT stocks tumbleThe sell-off was led by information technology stocks, which tumbled nearly 2% after President Donald Trump announced a $100,000 fee for new H-1B visa applications.

Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why is the stock market falling todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 503.31 points at 82,122.92 by 2:55 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 143.80 points to 25,183.20. Volatility surged across broader market segments, with most indices in the red.

IT sector faces H-1B visa jitters: Should you keep your money parked or sell?Recent changes to the H-1B visa programme have triggered new worries for Indian IT companies, already facing weaker client demand.

Turning 50? Here's how to protect your retirement savings, explains financial advisorHitting 50 can be a mix of pride and worry, especially when it comes to money. Even after years of saving and investing, many fear their retirement funds may not last as long as planned. Here are expert tips to safeguard your savings.

Errors in ITR filing? 3 simple ways to fix it: Revise, rectify or updateWorried about spotting a mistake in your ITR after filing? You're not alone. Errors happen to many taxpayers. Thankfully, the system gives you not one but three ways to fix them. Let's have a look.

Should you still bet on IT stocks as H-1B visa worries resurface?The US move on H-1B visa has stirred fears of rising costs and tighter restrictions on tech firms that rely on sending skilled workers to client locations.

GST 2.0 rate cut: Groceries, electronic items get cheaper this festive seasonThis report examines the impact of GST rate changes on household budgets, focusing on groceries and electronics. Items like chocolates and shampoos are now cheaper, with shampoos moving from an 18% to a 5% tax bracket. In contrast, aerated drinks are subject to a 'sin tax'. The report highlights significant savings, noting, "an average saving of 10% will mean 5000 rupees per month saving" for a consumer with a monthly income of one lakh rupees. The changes are presented as a "festive gift from the Modi government," with major electronics also seeing price drops. Televisions over 32 inches, previously in a 28% slab, are now taxed at 18%, resulting in substantial savings for consumers looking to upgrade. Washing machines, refrigerators, and dishwashers also benefit from a 10% tax reduction.

Live: GST 2.0 kicks off, BJP urges traders to pass on relief to consumersThe GST Council has approved major tax reforms effective today, September 22, introducing a simplified two-rate structure of 5% and 18% to ease compliance and lower costs. Essential items like soaps, shampoos, bicycles, and packaged foods will now attract 5% GST, while appliances such as ACs and large TVs will be taxed at 18%, down from 28%. Luxury and sin goods, including tobacco and high-end cars, will continue to face a 40% levy plus compensation cess. Follow Indiatoday.in for latest updates.

entertainment.headline: Rasha Thadani and Abhay Verma give BTS glimpses from Laikey Laikaa sets. PicsRasha Thadani and Abhay Verma shared playful behind-the-scenes moments from their upcoming romantic-action film 'Laikey Laikaa', slated for a 2026 release.

Soha Ali Khan shares producers once asked Rang De Basanti cast to return moneySoha Ali Khan shared that the producers of 'Rang De Basanti' once asked the cast to return part of their pay, unsure of the film's success.

Parag Tyagi remembers Shefali, shares details of her final moments: It slipped awayParag Tyagi, husband of late actor Shefali Jariwala, has launched a YouTube channel in her memory, where he shared emotional details about her final moments and unfulfilled dreams.

Sonam Kapoor shares update on her disruptive Bollywood comeback after motherhoodSonam Kapoor is set to return to films after spending the past few years focusing on motherhood and family life following the birth of her son, Vayu. She plans to choose projects with strong, layered female roles that resonate with her vision and tell meaningful stories.

I no longer recognise my country: Angelina Jolie over free speech concernAngelina Jolie expressed deep concern over the erosion of free speech in the United States while presenting her latest film at Spain's San Sebastián festival.

Rise & Fall: Kubbra Sait picked over Aarush Bhola to become rulerActor Kubbra Sait became the latest contestant to transition from being a worker to a ruler in the latest episode of 'Rise & Fall.' The decision followed a key vote amongst the rulers, who were confused between Kubrra and Aarush Bhola.

Zubeen Garg's second post-mortem on Tuesday after public demand: Assam CMAssam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced a fresh autopsy for singer Zubeen Garg amid ongoing investigations into his death, with the post-mortem scheduled at Guwahati Medical College.

Why Ranbir Kapoor's cameo in The Ba***s of Bollywood has created controversyActor Ranbir Kapoor's brief cameo in Aryan Khan's Netflix series 'The Ba***s of Bollywood' has drawn the attention of the Human Rights Commission over a vape scene. Here's what happens in the scene and if it matters.

Riddhima welcomes Dilip with garland, Farah says he's demanding higher salaryRiddhima Kapoor Sahni recently welcomed Farah Khan and her cook Dilip with garlands at her Delhi home. During their interaction, the filmmaker joked about Dilip demanding a higher salary after gaining widespread attention.

71st National Film Awards: When and where to watch the ceremony liveThe 71st National Film Awards will take place on September 23 in New Delhi. The awardees will be honoured by President Droupadi Murmu.

Zubeen Garg's voice to be digitally preserved to prevent AI misuseZubeen Garg's voice will be digitally preserved to safeguard it from AI misuse and unauthorised tampering. His close associate, Manas Robin, said a unique 'digital signature' will be created to ensure the authenticity of his vocals.

Fatima Sana Shaikh not in The Wives, Madhur Bhandarkar clears the airMadhur Bhandarkar has completed filming 'The Wives', clarifying that Fatima Sana Shaikh was never part of the cast despite rumours. The film stars Regina Cassandra, Sonali Kulkarni and Mouni Roy.

Court summons Malayalam actor Unni Mukundan in manager assault caseMalayalam actor Unni Mukundan has been summoned by the Kakkanad Magistrate's Court in an assault case filed by his former manager Vipin Kumar. The 'Marco' star earlier denied all allegations, calling them false and insisting Kumar was never his manager.

Adhira first look out: Kalyan Dasari faces SJ Suryah in superhero multiverseThe first-look poster for Prasanth Varma's 'Adhira' was launched among high anticipation. SJ Suryah and Kalyan Dasari feature in the lead roles in the film.

How Aryan Khan turns privilege into power with The Ba***ds of BollywoodAryan Khan's Netflix debut 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' turns nepotism on its head, blending insider access, satire, and self-trolls into a guilty pleasure only an SRK heir could pull off.

Bigg Boss 19: Awez Darbar's viral 'chai bana' moment gets a hilarious remixAwez Darbar's humorous 'chai bana aur sabko pila' moment from 'Bigg Boss' went viral after music producer Zaynul Jiwani turned it into a funny Instagram reel. Fans and even Awez's sister, Anam Darbar, reacted, making the clip one of the most talked-about moments from the show.

Marisa Abela on voicing Lizzie in Pride and Prejudice audiobook, love for Indian filmsMarisa Abela has voiced Elizabeth Bennet in Audible's latest 'Pride and Prejudice' adaptation. Her passion for the role and love for Indian cinema shine through in this exclusive interview.

Amitabh Bachchan wins hearts by gifting umbrellas, helmets to fans at JalsaAmitabh Bachchan continued his Sunday ritual at Jalsa by greeting fans and surprising them with gifts like umbrellas and helmets.

Exclusive: Homebound has a chance to win an Oscar, says FFI jury head'Homebound' has been selected as India's official entry for the 98th Academy Awards. The film's focus on caste and religion highlights pressing social issues in India and offers a strong Oscar contender.

Time to decriminalise defamation: Supreme Court's big commentI think time has come to decriminalise all this, a Supreme Court judge said on Monday while hearing a criminal defamation case filed against a news website.

30 killed as Pakistan Air Force bombs village in Khyber PakhtunkhwaAround 2 am today, the Pakistan Air Force dropped eight LS-6 bombs from JF-17 fighter jets on the Matre Dara village in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.

Rights body wants action against Ranbir Kapoor over vaping scene in Ba***dsThe National Human Rights Commission has asked Mumbai police to file a case against Ranbir Kapoor for his vaping scene in 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'.

How Pakistan brought mujahid mentality to the cricket pitchPakistani cricketers' provocative gestures, like Sahibzada Farhan's AK-47 gunfire mimicry and Haris Rauf's plane-shooting taunt, have exposed their "mujahid" mentality. Their antics, seen as militant symbolism on the pitch, have exposed the jihad rot that has percolated every strata of Pakistani society. It has bolstered the case for a boycott of the Pakistani team.

Russia offers to abide by expiring nuclear treaty for 1 year if US does the samePutin said an extension would serve the interests of global non-proliferation and open the door for talks with Washington on a potential successor agreement.

HPV tests can be scary, but a positive result doesn't mean cervical cancerWhile HPV is linked to cervical cancer, not every infection is dangerous, and with regular screening and vaccination, most cases of the disease can be prevented.

What is 'I Love Muhammad' row and why did it spark protests across India?The 'I Love Muhammad' slogan, first contested during a Barawafat procession in Kanpur, has triggered protests and processions by the Muslim community across several states. Clashes with police, FIRs, and social media debates have intensified the controversy, drawing attention from political leaders and religious organisations.

Gautam Singhania's 'another day, another Lamborghini crash' video post goes viralGautam Singhania, Chairman and Managing Director of Raymond Ltd, shared a now-viral video of a speeding Lamborghini that rammed into the divider on Mumbai's Coastal Road.

Modern couples open up about their biggest money fightsIt's not unusual for couples to have big fights over money. We bring you stories from six couples who share what sparked their biggest money battles.

MBA Chaiwala is being blamed for the new H-1B visa rule. But why?A picture of MBA Chai Wala founder standing outside Google's headquarters in California has set off a wave of memes, with social media users jokingly linking his visit to the United States government's new H-1B visa fee rule.

Farhan breaks silence on gun celebration vs India: Don't care how people take itPakistan opener Sahibzada Farhan commented on his gun celebration during the India clash in the Asia Cup 2025. Farhan scored a fifty during the game and his celebration went viral and was panned on social media

Mahishasur, demon or hero? Navratra reminds us of India's contested pastStanding tall atop Chamundi Hill, the granite statue of Mahishasur embodies a paradox: vilified as a demon in Mysore's Dussehra, yet revered as a hero by India's indigenous communities. He embodies India's dynamic history and conflicting myths.

China our great friend, but CPEC is last opportunity, says cash-strapped Pak PMPrime Minister Shehbaz Sharif cautions against delays in executing CPEC 2 projects worth over $8 billion. He stresses this is Pakistan's last opportunity to benefit from Chinese expertise and investment.

Help isn't around: Shux reveals how astronauts perform CPR in spaceMedical emergencies tops the list of scenarios astronauts prepare for extensively. Shukla explained that the crew spends countless hours practicing medical drills with mannequins simulating cardiac arrest.

A phenomenon called Zubeen Garg and how Mayabini became an anthemAssam has been plunged into an unprecedented mourning after Zubeen Garg's death, with lakhs singing and humming Zubeen's song 'Mayabini Ratir Bukut' into a collective anthem of grief. From Guwahati to cities across India, the outpouring has revealed the true scale of Zubeen Da's cultural and emotional enigma in his fans.

West tilts toward two-state solution for Palestine. India was aheadThe West is finally waking up to an idea India has long stood by: that peace in the Middle East rests on an independent Palestinian state.

Woman seeks Rs 5 crore alimony after just a year of marriage, top court raps herThe Supreme Court has cautioned a wife seeking 5 crore for dissolving her marriage, warning of a harsh order if such demands persist. The court has asked both parties to return to mediation, impacting ongoing litigation.

Video: SUV falls into pothole in Patna, owner claims conspiracy to defame governmentVehicle owner Nitu Singh Choubey said that the accident could have been prevented if proper road maintenance and safety measures had been in place. She claimed that it was a conspiracy to defame the Nitish Kumar government.

sports.headline: Sahibzada Farhan wants Pakistan to solve middle-order woes in Sri Lanka clashAsia Cup 2025: Sahibzada Farhan said that Pakistan need to solve their issues with the middle-order in their do-or-die clash against Sri Lanka on Tuesday, September 23 at the Sheikh Zayed Stadium in Abu Dhabi.

Before Women's World Cup, Pakistan spinner warms up with historic ODI spellNashra Sandhu made history by becoming the first left-arm Asian spinner to take a six-wicket haul in a Women's ODI, claiming 6-26 in 9 overs against South Africa at Lahore on September 22.

Pakistan's tea celebration backfires as India win SAFF U-17 Championship tieThe Pakistan team's tea celebration backfired on Monday, September 22, as India defeated them 3-2 to make it to the semi-finals of the SAFF U-17 Championship. The win comes a few hours after the men's cricket team beat Pakistan in Asia Cup 2025.

Pakistan confident of reaching final for 3rd possible clash vs India: FarhanPakistan opener Sahibzada Farhan said the team is confident ahead of their Super 4 clash against Sri Lanka, aiming for the Asia Cup final and a potential third meeting with India.

Abhishek Sharma opens up on 'L' celebration after hammering PakistanAsia Cup 2025: Abhishek Sharma revealed that his "L" celebration stands for Love, dedicated to fans, Team India, and IPL supporters after his match-winning 74 against Pakistan. He also spoke about his long-standing camaraderie with Shubman Gill.

Newcastle United missing Alexander Isak? Eddie Howe reacts after Bournemouth drawNewcastle United boss Eddie Howe admits his side is still adjusting to life without Alexander Isak after another 0-0 draw. The Magpies are learning to adapt to record signing Nick Woltemade's style.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
